item.title: Halsted add a quote by They Might Be Giants
item.description: "I don't want the whole world, I just want your half." -- They Might Be Giants

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "It is an impressively arrogant move to conclude that just because you don’t like something, it is empirically not good. I don’t like Chinese food, but I don’t write articles trying to prove it doesn’t exist." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"to live in this world
you must be able to do three things to love what is mortal; to hold it
against your bones knowing your own life depends on it; and, when the time comes to let it go, to let it go" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"When it's over, I want to say: all my life I was a bride married to amazement. I was the bridegroom, taking the world into my arms.
When it is over, I don't want to wonder if I have made of my life something particular, and real. I don't want to find myself sighing and frightened, or full of argument.
I don't want to end up simply having visited this world." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You must not ever stop being whimsical. And you must not, ever, give anyone else the responsibility for your life." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Libraries really are wonderful. They're better than bookshops, even. I mean bookshops make a profit on selling you books, but libraries just sit there lending you books quietly out of the goodness of their hearts." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "If you love books enough, books will love you back." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Bibliotropic," Hugh said. "Like sunflowers are heliotropic, they naturally turn towards the sun. We naturally turn towards the bookshop." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "I care more about the people in books than the people I see every day." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Interlibrary loans are a wonder of the world and a glory of civilization." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Class is entirely intangible, and the way it affects things isn't subject to scientific analysis, and it's not supposed to be real but it's pervasive and powerful. See; just like magic." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "If I were omnipotent and omnibenevolent I wouldn't be so damn ineffable." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Halsted add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will take the Ring", he said, "though I do not know the way." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Robert Charles Wilson
item.description: "Children wear their natures like brightly-colored clothes; that's why they lie so transparently. Adulthood is the art of deceit." -- Robert Charles Wilson

item.title: Halsted add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I wanted so badly to lie down next to her on the couch, to wrap my arms around her and sleep. Not fuck, like in those movies. Not even have sex. Just sleep together in the most innocent sense of the phrase. But I lacked the courage and she had a boyfriend and I was gawky and she was gorgeous and I was hopelessly boring and she was endlessly fascinating. So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: Halsted add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When adults say, "Teenagers think they are invincible" with that sly, stupid smile on their faces, they don't know how right they are. We need never be hopeless, because we can never be irreparably broken. We think that we are invincible because we are. We cannot be born, and we cannot die. Like all energy, we can only change shapes and sizes and manifestations. They forget that when they get old. They get scared of losing and failing. But that part of us greater than the sum of our parts cannot begin and cannot end, and so it cannot fail." -- John Green

item.title: Halsted add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Halsted add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps." -- John Green

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through." -- Ira Glass

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "A thing may happen and be a total lie; another thing may not happen and be truer than the truth." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Halsted add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "You will always be the bread and the knife, not to mention the crystal goblet and—somehow—the wine." -- Billy Collins
